Name: Geroderma osteodysplastica
Synonyms_List__c: Geroderma osteodysplasticum, Gerodermia osteodysplastica, GO, Walt Disney dwarfism
Disease_Description__c: Geroderma osteodysplasticum (GO) is an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by skin wrinkling limited to the dorsa of hands and feet and to the abdomen, bowed long bones, and osteopenia with frequent fractures. There is a distinctive facial appearance with droopy skin at the cheeks, maxillary hypoplasia, and large ears. Adult patients appear prematurely aged (summary by Rajab et al., 2008).
